alert.note: Alert for Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with heavy rainfall will impact portions of southern and central Erie County through 500 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Harborcreek to McKean to near Albion. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding is possible in areas of poor drainage. Locations impacted include... Edinboro, Union City, Waterford, Albion, Wattsburg, Cranesville, Platea, Mill Village and McKean. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northwestern Pennsylvania.
